import React, { Component } from 'react'; import sppVideoBg from '../../../Images/videos/video1.mp4'; import './WhatWeDo.css'; import {researchDetails} from './data'; export default class WhatWeDo extends Component { render() { const contactLi =researchDetails.details.map(item=>{ return

    • }) return (

    What We Do

    As for research interest of Dr. Roy, the members of the SPP group are involved in the broad area of “Processing-Structure-Property correlation” through the understanding of micro-mechanisms that governs the fundamental mechanical response of materials. Our studies are mostly experimental in nature, however, we always try to complement out experimental results with various simulation based approach (Density functional theory, Artificial neural network etc.). The ongoing research activities are given below :

    • Microstructure formation, macro-zone removal of Ti-alloys Objective of the study is to observe microstructure and texture evolution in as-cast and thermo-mechanically processed (rolled, forged and extruded) two-phase Ti-6Al-4V alloys. For that, reconstruction of β-phase from room temperature α-phase was carried out to observe prior β grain morphology and texture. Furthermore, grain boundary α and elemental distribution effect was considered for microstructure and texture formation. In addition, crystallography of the α/β- or α/α-phase interface was noticed for the as-cast and thermo-mechanically processed alloys.

    • Microstructure formation, macro-zone removal of Ti-alloys Objective of the study is to observe microstructure and texture evolution in as-cast and thermo-mechanically processed (rolled, forged and extruded) two-phase Ti-6Al-4V alloys. For that, reconstruction of β-phase from room temperature α-phase was carried out to observe prior β grain morphology and texture. Furthermore, grain boundary α and elemental distribution effect was considered for microstructure and texture formation. In addition, crystallography of the α/β- or α/α-phase interface was noticed for the as-cast and thermo-mechanically processed alloys.
